questions.text: Who had a cameo in the cold opening?
questions.explanation:
Tip O'Neill.

	Tip O'Neill was born December 9, 1912 in Cambridge, MA. He was Speaker of the House from 1977-1987. He died of colon cancer in 1994. In the episode he went into Cheers to dodge a woman that wouldn't stop talking to him. It turned out that the woman was Diane.

Heide Perlman.

	Heide Perlman is Rhea Perlman's sister. She wrote several episodes of "Cheers".

Miss Boston Barmaid.

	Carla had mixed feelings about this contest. She claimed it was a sham and degrading yet she was frustrated she could never be in it because she was always pregnant.

questions.text: Which of the Cheers crowd was a finalist in the contest?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Diane was not going to do the contest but found out if she won she could reach millions of people to tell them how degrading this contest and contests like it were. Sam had entered her in the contest by submitting a picture of her that he found in her wallet.

questions.text: What job did Cliff Clavin have?
questions.explanation:
mailman.

	Cliff took his job as mailman very seriously, a little too seriously in fact. He wore his postal uniform to the bar everyday with pride.

questions.text: Had Cheers won the contest in the past?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Sam told Diane that Cheers never won. He thought it would be nice if they did win and if Diane won it for them.

questions.text: How many years had the contest been going on for?
questions.explanation:
45 years.

	There was a big sign that said it was the 45th contest. Diane ended up doing the contest and Sam gave her tips on how she might win.

questions.text: What did Cliff say he looked for in a woman?
questions.explanation:
low standards.

	Cliff has never been big with women. In one episode he claimed he didn't have a girlfriend because it was not fair to ask a woman to be the girlfriend of a postal worker because postal work is so dangerous.

Diane.

	Diane planned to tell how much she hated contests like this one but she found out if she won she'd be on "AM Boston" so she went through with the contest. However, when she won she was so excited by the prize she forgot about her speech.

questions.text: Where did the winner win a trip to?
questions.explanation:
Bermuda.

	Diane said she sold out for a trip to Bermuda. Sam told her not to feel bad because most people would have sold out for the free dry cleaning.
